data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, the instructions would say you never turn backwards. So, the answer is Yes.

The instructions 'Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward.' 'Take 1 step in direction to the right.'. 'Take 4 steps in direction again.'. 'Take 6 steps forward.'. 'Take 1 step left.'. 'Take 4 steps forward.'. 'Take 6 steps forward.'. 'Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward.'. 'Take 6 steps forward.'. 'Take 1 step in direction to the right.'. 'Take 6 steps forward.'. 'Take 1 step left.'. It' s just 4 steps forward. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you return to the starting point, you would first take 3 steps then take 9 steps. If you turn around to get back to your starting point, you would only take 2 steps then take 7 steps then take 3 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

People often take these steps backwards so that they can get into a new place. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

When you face forward all the time, you always want to be facing forward. Walking backwards, you are going to step right, not forward. When you take a step backward and cross the street, you are not going to pass that area or city. Even though you are going to pass that area or city, you are still going to move forward. Walking left, you are still moving forward and are in the center of the circle. So, the answer is no.

You always face forward when you are taking the same steps. In the beginning, you are always facing forward, except for the first step, the "slowest" and the last step. The second step is the "fastest" step of the entire sequence, the "mid-step." The third step is the "last step" of the sequence. One of the steps is "least" and the last step is "mostly" equal to the first step. So, the answer is Yes.
